sense.name: something which serves as a rationale
sense.commentary: JUSTIFICATION[+relation][+rationale] Note: Does not imply a statement by someone, (Sense 2) but a perceived connection between things Note: often of the form 'X BE justification'
sense.examples: They considered his dictatorship a justification for revolution. The current rise in inflation may not be a sufficient justification to raise interest rates.

sense.name: the act of explaining or defending something
sense.commentary: JUSTIFICATION[+action][+statement][+explanation][+defense] Note: implies someone's action of explaining something Note: often of the form 'X's justification of Y'
sense.examples: They were not interested in Bob's justification of why he was late for the meeting. The leader's justification of his actions was not persuasive to the opposition. The CEO presented his justification for the recent layoffs at the board meeting.

sense.name: aligning the words of a text to a margin
sense.examples: I used left justification for all my paragraphs in that document. Newspaper columns observe both left and right justification.
